definition: ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements

sentences.english: " Only strong personalities can endure history, the weak ones are extinguished by it. " — Friedrich Nietzsche.
sentences.chinese: 只有刚烈的个性方能承受历史，懦弱的则消失其中。

sentences.english: And finally, being the hot-tempered man he was, his holiness was all ready to fly into a rage.
sentences.chinese: 最终，他这个脾气刚烈的人，他的作风充满了个性。

sentences.english: He has a very strong personality and always stands firmly by his principles.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格很刚烈，很有原则，对我们非常严厉。

sentences.english: Hats are equally important in protecting your face from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 遮阳帽则让太阳的强光，在你细嫩面部之外显示刚烈。

sentences.english: This role represents a man of virile or rough character like warriors.
sentences.chinese: 这个角色代表性格刚烈或粗暴的男性，比如武士。

sentences.english: The people thusing knock me down only make me stronger.
sentences.chinese: 想要打击我的人只会让我更坚毅刚烈。

sentences.english: The people thworries knock me down only make me stronger.
sentences.chinese: 想要打击我的人只会让我更坚毅刚烈。

definition: to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
ready to die to preserve one's chastity
the Way of the Hegemon/abbr. for 霸王之道/despotic rule/rule by might/evil as opposed to the Way of the King 王道/overbearing/tyranny/(of liquor, medicine etc) strong/potent
